title: US says Trump prefers diplomacy with Iran but warns he has military options
byline: The White House said on Thursday that diplomacy is President Donald Trump’s first choice for dealing with Iran and he will wait to see whether a deal can be struck at high-stakes talks, but also warned that he has military options at his disposal.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: SC rules Parliamentary Pensions Repeal Bill can be passed with simple majority
byline: The Supreme Court has determined that no provision in the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill is inconsistent with the Constitution, and that it can be enacted by Parliament with a simple majority, Speaker of the House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne stated.

title: Police enhance security measures for 2026 ICC T20 World Cup matches
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced that a total of 1,500 police officers and 600 traffic police officers will be deployed to ensure the safety and security of both local and foreign spectators attending the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Cricket Tournament.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo during 2026 ICC T20 World Cup matches
byline: A special traffic plan will be implemented in Colombo during the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Cricket Tournament, which will be held from February 07 to March 08, 2026.

title: President to launch compensation, housing projects for Cyclone Ditwah victims in Kandy today
byline: The programme to commence the construction of new houses for individuals whose homes were fully or partially damaged by Cyclone Ditwah in the Kandy District, along with the awarding of compensation and the launch of several development projects, is scheduled to take place in Kandy today (06)...

title: Gen Z became first generation to be less intelligent than millennials as IQ dropped, expert
byline: Recent studies suggest that Gen Z is the first and only generation to be less intelligent than the one before it, making millennials the only generation to outperform the younger generation that followed.

title: Three suspects arrested with ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 20 mln at BIA
byline: A Sri Lankan passenger who arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) has been arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle a consignment of ‘Kush’ valued at over Rs. 20 million into the country.

title: Train services on main line delayed
byline: Trains operating along the main railway line are currently experiencing delays, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Anusha Palpita further remanded
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Mass Media and former Chairman of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), Anusha Palpita, has been further remanded until February 20 by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Court defers decision on Dayasiri’s petition over SLFP General Secretary post
byline: The Colombo District Court today (06) ordered that the delivery of the verdict on the case filed by Member of Parliament Dayasiri Jayasekara be postponed until February 17.

title: Decisions and judgments of Supreme Court reflect justice in country – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the decisions and judgments delivered within the Supreme Court complex serve as a mirror that clearly reflects the justice, democracy, and the rule of law in Sri Lanka.

title: Norway investigates former PM Jagland over alleged Epstein links
byline: Police in Norway have opened a corruption investigation into the country’s former Prime Minister Thorbjørn Jagland over his alleged links to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Woman arrested with ‘Hashish’ and ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 15 mln
byline: A woman was arrested by the Western Province North Crime Division during an operation carried out in the Nirmala Mawatha area of Boralesgamuwa.

title: Govt ready to commence paddy purchases in upcoming season – Dy Minister
byline: The Deputy Minister of Lands and Irrigation, Aravinda Senarath, informed Parliament today (06) that the government has completed all necessary arrangements to commence the purchasing of paddy.

title: President’s Fund allocates over Rs. 1.9 bln for schoolchildren affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: An allocation of Rs. 1,925,010,000.00 has been made from the President’s Fund to provide a Rs. 10,000 allowance for schoolchildren in all districts affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: NASA will finally let astronauts take smartphones to the Moon
byline: NASA is about to make a small but meaningful change that feels very human. For the first time, astronauts heading toward the Moon will be allowed to carry modern smartphones, including iPhones.

title: Seven school students hospitalized following violent clash in Beruwala
byline: Seven students were admitted to Kalutara Teaching Hospital after sustaining injuries in a violent clash between students from two schools in the Beruwala area.

title: Bombing at mosque in Pakistan kills at least 31 and wounds scores
byline: A massive bombing ripped through a Shiite mosque on the outskirts of Pakistan’s capital during Friday prayers, killing 31 people and wounding at least 169 others, police said.

title: Ex-Sooriyakanda OIC, constable arrested for killing of Sambar deer
byline: The former Officer-in-Charge (OIC) and a Police Constable attached to the Sooriyakanda Police station have been arrested by the Central Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) in connection with the alleged killing of a Sambar deer, police said.

title: PM assures govt will not use emergency regulations to suppress media or any group
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated in Parliament today (06) that the Government will under no circumstances use emergency regulations to suppress the media or any section of society.

title: Former Minister Keheliya’s daughter arrested
byline: Chamithri Rambukwella, the eldest daughter of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, has been arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Parliament approves extension of State of Public Emergency
byline: The extension of the State of Public Emergency has been approved by Parliament, with 106 members voting in favor and 2 voting against, a short while ago.

title: Russian general shot several times in Moscow
byline: A high-profile general in Russia’s military has been shot several times and wounded in Moscow.

title: Zayn Malik announces new album and world tour
byline: You wait ages for former One Direction singers to drop new music, then four come along almost all at once.

title: SLTB creates history with appointment of 20 female bus conductors
byline: In a historic first, a total of twenty newly-recruited female bus conductors have officially received their letters of appointment from the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB).

title: Sri Lankan govt. to pursue reparations for colonial-era losses
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath says that the process of pursuing compensation for colonial-era losses and seek the return of looted cultural treasures is currently underway.

title: Construction of Gatambe Flyover resumes under President’s patronage
byline: The resumption of construction on the Gatambe Flyover in Kandy, which had been halted for several years, commenced this afternoon (06) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: 2025 O/L tuition classes prohibited from midnight on Feb 11
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that the conducting of tuition classes and other activities targeting students facing the 2025 G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination will be prohibited from midnight on 11 February (Wednesday) until the conclusion of the examination.

title: Iran, US nuclear talks in Oman were a good start, Iran’s top diplomat says
byline: High-stakes nuclear talks between Iran and the United States held in Oman on Friday were a good beginning and will continue, Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said.

title: JVP’s Tilvin Silva meets Jaishankar, discuss strengthening India–Sri Lanka ties
byline: A meeting has been held in New Delhi between the General Secretary of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Tilvin Silva, accompanied by a delegation from Sri Lanka, and Minister of External Affairs of India, S. Jaishankar.

title: Sri Lanka’s foreign policy firmly anchored in economic diplomacy – FM
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism stated that Sri Lanka’s foreign policy is firmly anchored in economic diplomacy, with a strong focus on trade, investment, tourism promotion, and innovation.

title: President Anura Kumara launches Mahaiyawa underpass project
byline: The construction of the Mahaiyawa Underpass Bridge on the Kandy–Jaffna Road (A-009), a key entry point to Kandy City, commenced this morning (06) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Former Minister Keheliya’s daughter granted bail
byline: Chamithri Rambukwella, the eldest daughter of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, has been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: No new laws on seine nets, only enforcing existing regulations – Fisheries DG
byline: The Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources has stated that no new laws have been enacted regarding the use of seine nets, and that only existing legislations are being enforced.

title: Edu. Ministry calls applications from graduates for teaching vacancies in schools
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education has issued a notification calling applications from graduates for teaching vacancies in Sinhala, Tamil, and English medium schools across the island.

title: Bus driver arrested for cannabis use after high-speed collision in Kalutara
byline: Two buses that allegedly travelled at high speed while racing have reportedly collided at the Wettumakada Junction within the Kalutara South Police Division.

title: Special traffic plan implemented at Green Path in Colombo
byline: A special traffic management plan has been announced by the police with effect from tonight (06) in the Green Path premises along Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, within the Cinnamon Gardens Police Division.

title: President assures extension of emergency law solely to accelerate reconstruction
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated that the extension of the emergency law is aimed solely at speeding up the reconstruction process and will not be used as a tool for repression.

title: Speaker requested to amend standing orders to prevent verbal harassment of women MPs
byline: The Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus has submitted a request yesterday (05) to the Speaker of Parliament, requesting amendments to the Standing Orders of Parliament in order to prevent conduct or statements by Members of Parliament...

title: Laugfs Gas increases prices
byline: Laugfs Gas has announced new domestic gas refill prices for February 2026, effective from midnight today (06).
